pros: Clean facility And very organized.
cons: It is a strict environment

pros: The residents are completely awesome
cons: Executive leadership is very clueless

pros: Good working conditions great customer service
cons: Not applicable for now still new

pros: It’s a solid job and nice people.
cons: You will get points for even family emergencies. Only allowed 12 points per YEAR. Over working staff for little pay.

pros: They never kick out residents who fall on hard times. They have a benevolent care program.
cons: They are disorganized and lack basic infrastructure. There are no merit raises for upper management.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Corvallis, OR
pros: Schedule, location, wonderful residents, always hours available
cons: More focus on drama than patient care, work load unmanageable due to lack of staff and lack of management being willing to help out

review_title: Overall better than most long-term care but not without it's downfalls
pros: Great hourly pay, good insurance and benefits packages
cons: Upper management makes decisions with complete disregard for their licensed staff. When concerns and valid issues and points are presented they are immediately shut down. We were told by the DON that she wants to hear our concerns and work together but does not back up any of her promises or words with actions.  Of all the facilities I’ve worked for the CNAs are a mix of the best most compassionate hard working aides to the worst impolite, disrespectful, untitled, lazy aides that can be downright vindictive at times.  The CNAs basically run the show at this facility which is one of the biggest cons of working here. They act as if their work is more important than the nurses.  The continuity of care is practically non-existent.

pros: A great place to work.  Willing to help you grow your skills and do your job well.  PTO Time off is very generous / flexible.
cons: Non clinical workers cannot work from home on occasion.

pros: The place is a great to work. They will hire within if they have openings and you've been at your current position for at least 6 months before transfer. They assist with tuition through scholarship for employees in good standing and working there for at least a year (no write-ups, suspensions, etc).
cons: I can't think of any.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Lancaster, PA
pros: Wonderful staff and management, work was always fun and interesting. I established great friendships with co-workers. Very flexible schedule and able to take off when necessary.
cons: Shifts were only available at certain times throughout the day so I did not get as many hours as I would have liked,

review_title: A few changes and this might be a company worth working for
pros: Friendly co-workers and Management
cons: lousy PTO.  Non-essential staff have to use vacation time for major holidays.

pros: They off good pay and great benefits for full time and part time employees
cons: Has a very toxic employee culture and employees do not like to help each other or work together. Constantly changing employee positions and the roles that go along with it.

job_title: Director of Facilities in Lancaster, PA
pros: The best place I have ever worked. The people care about your success.
cons: There are no cons to working at MH & WCV

pros: Very flexible hours for students going to school.
cons: I have nothing bad to say.
